definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: In respect of asexual propagation, both of the two species can produce viviparous plantlets.
sentences.chinese: 在无性繁殖方面，二者都通过克隆生长形成胎生苗。

sentences.english: Ichthyosaurs and other contemporary viviparous species, by contrast, gave birth to multiple offspring.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，鱼龙和其他现代胎生的物种产下多个幼崽。

sentences.english: Quite similar to that of mammals.
sentences.chinese: 有点儿近似于哺乳动物的胎生。

sentences.english: Does now consider?True strong. The ability of somebody else mama one viviparous 3.
sentences.chinese: 现在想一想？真强。人家妈能一胎生三个。

sentences.english: Man and most other mammals are viviparous .
sentences.chinese: 人和其他大多数哺乳动物都是胎生的。

sentences.english: And you, " they said, "how many sons have you at a birth?
sentences.chinese: 那么你，“他们说，”你一胎生多少个幼师呢？

sentences.english: Which animal gives birth to its baby?
sentences.chinese: 哪种动物的后代是胎生的？

sentences.english: Every birds bird is oviparous, and it is viviparity however.
sentences.chinese: 凡禽鸟都是卵生，而它却是胎生的。

sentences.english: All animals, however, that are hair-coated are viviparous .
sentences.chinese: 然而，所有有体毛的动物是胎生的。

sentences.english: Surman, an American unemployed woman, at a birth.
sentences.chinese: 美国无业妇女苏尔曼一胎生了八个孩子。

sentences.english: Lady Wang, Jia Zheng's wife first gave birth to a son, named Jia Zhu.
sentences.chinese: 这位政老爷的夫人王氏，头胎生的公子，名唤贾珠。

definition: to become pregnant/to carry a child in the womb
to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
to give birth without complications/easy childbirth/safe delivery/natural birth (without surgical operation)
to carry on one's ancestral line
to value males and attach less importance to females (idiom)
parthenogenesis (biol. a female reproducing without fertilization)
to give birth (animals)/to bear a litter
